title: Men and manners in Britain;
author: Thorburn, Grant
snippet: As there was no exception specified in favour of either peripatetic authors,  or any other harmless class of mortal, he of course abstained from his intended meditations among the tombs ; though not without resolving to make the unapproachability of the burial-ground of Scoonie a little more extensively known.

title: Men and manners in Britain;
author: Thorburn, Grant
snippet: As there was no exception specified in favour of either peripatetic authors,  or any other harmless class of mortals, he of course abstained from his intended meditations among the tombs ; though not without resolving to make the unapproachability of the burial-ground of Scoonie a little more extensively known.

title: Recollections of a Visit to Glasgow with the British Archæological Associations, August 27th to September 5th, 1888. With notes
author: Lambert, George
snippet: 6hire; Scoonie, Fifeshire ; Golspie, Sutherlandshire; Brochof Bumian, Orkney; and Brassey, Cunningsburgh; Gigha,Lunnasting, and St. Ninians, Shetland.
